div.p: S. D. P. I received your letter, given on October 21st, but not at the right time. The messenger was slow; he did not deliver the letter. Therefore, I ask that you do not be angry with me and continue to inform us of the situation; for there are many rumors among us; everyone speaks according to their own preference.

We have many papists and many imperialists; each speaks according to his own liking. There is nothing special with us, except that the French are constantly moving in and out. The imperialists are confident; they believe that fortune has allied itself with them. May God bring it to a good end. Our sins demand such punishment and even worse. May the Lord God be gracious to us. Farewell in the Lord. Chur, November 1st, 1552.
Philippus, Pontasella, Haimius, and Tscharnerus greet you.
